Many things through out our existence on Earth can be pin pointed to seconds that changed your life. A new life, losing a life, a new love, or finding a love that never really left... We can go on and on with examples but I think that it would take far too long.

Making the most of your life while you are on the planet means alot of all of us. Humans have been on the planet for 3 million years. With the average life span for a present day person is around the age of 70-80 thats a very short time to prove ourself. Who said we need to figure out the question and answer to solve the universe though? We have just a limited amount of time so we are kids, we go to school, we get jobs, families, and so on and so on. Its a linear path we take more on our shoulders then we should at times. Someone that wants to solve world hunger, global warming, obtain world peace. At the equator the Earth is 250,000 miles around. That is just to far for just one human. Banding together is the only way to get a job that big done.

Thats one of those seconds. Just one moment in our lives create a chain of events. Helping some one pick up something, taking the time to just wait and throw that piece of garbage away, doing the right thing, again the list is endless. But it defines you and who you've effect. Of course the same rules imply to the bad choices you make. Normally those are the ones that people see in your life. So its hard to change certain things about the bad things... But you can again take those few seconds to prove them wrong set another chain of events in to the world.

The few seconds are either something you can control or you can't you have no way of knowing what will happen.
Uncontrollable- You were in a car accident that wasn't yout fault, you couldn't prevent it but you are still here and you could have had alot worse happen.
Controllable- You hold that door opened for the person behind you. (you've probably seen the commercial for some insurance company, or seen "Pay it Foward") But then they do something right and so on.

When you look at life you normally break it down in to time. You are friends in high school but then drift apart for the most part. You date someone and then break up. You can pin point those events. But look back and you'll notice that if this didn't happen then this couldn't happen. Everything, EVERYTHING happens for a reason. It doesn't have to be a good reason but in the end you'll have learned something and you'll realize that you could be for the better.

My few seconds, my chain of events I think started in 4th grade. Yeah life went on before then but 4th grade is where I can pin point it.  Where did your few seconds happen? Maybe they haven't yet? Maybe your life has been lineary. But remember everysecond cause when you look back at your life you'll want to know when you few seconds happened.



(And no I didn't just see a insurance commercial or finished watching Pay it Foward actually I never watched the whole thing)

How can one person define who they are? Are you not able to know how much of an impact you have been on this planet until you die? Or is it just by how you treat everything around you? There are people that make an impact right away be that with money or touching someone in life. But do big accomplishments measure to the same as the little ones? I mean you could donate a million dollars to some charity, or you could save a life and you weren't trained to do it you just saw the person and know it was the right thing to do..... 

Deep enough for ya? Guess I've been thinking on who I am lately. I had my senior yearbook out and reading through some of the things people wrote. Its the last some people ever know from that person. I'm upset with myself. I had a lot of friends in high school. But I don't have anything from them. But turn it around and I have a few things from people that I don't talk to much anymore and they really touched me... I know I had some good friends and I hope i was just as good of a friend to them as they were to me. Looking at the group shot I saw my best friends that i stood by in it, but also saw my old best friends in the back..... I thought to myself I should have stood by them in the picture... That could have been my last time to actually be with them forever.... (in a book) I still have a best friend from high school and I really know what a friend is by him being there for me and myself being there for him.

So question for you all. Does who you hang out define who you are to some extent? I think yes. after being around friends for so long you take a part of them in to yourself, and they you. So by the end of your life you will be everyone you've ever befriended. You pick up mannerisms, voices,  actions, habits. I know from personal experience that I take bits and pieces from my friends and use them. I've caught myself talking like Meimi, acting like Chris, thinking like Lys. Its not a bad thing I'm still myself but I'm them as well. Its strange when you think about it because no matter how hard we as humans try to be individuals we are doing something everyone else has does it. You can say just be yourself but you are going to be yourself no matter what. 

Yeah I've been thinking a lot about being your own person a little bit because of whats happened to me in the recent months. Is she being her own person? Or is she taking in what everyone around her is telling her to do? I know she's a big girl and she can make up her own mind. But what if she doesn't know what she wants? I know what I want but not at the expense of making her upset. No matter what she'll always be on my mind. I'll always have a part of her like I do the rest of my friends. I took a lot out of that relationship. Most important thing i was able to learn was what love is. I did tell someone I loved them before I had met her. But in reality It wasn't pure true love. Not what I had with her.  Like I said before, things in life change in a instant and you have to either take them in stride or let them take you down. I took the latter of the two. I'm working on it though. Different things all the time remind me of. Its hard to look at my friends and not remember the first time we all shared together or little things in my life that have a connection to her. Yeah some of you had said that I should get rid of anything that reminds me of her..... So you want me to live in a box in like Los Angeles? Yeah thats an extreme but it makes you see the connections i have to everything around me that are to her.  I hope in someway I've been able to touch her, been able to make her think differently, look at life in a different way.....  Guess I won't know now. But still I have hope. All love is a mystery it moves in and out not stopping or waiting. But thats why we are able to love. We are able to wait and love will come back maybe not how you wanted it to. But it does.

But in the back of your heart there is a part where love doesn't wrap all around. Its that part where bad things can creep out and take hold of the weakest chain in love and break it making it that much weaker. It puts some doubt in to you. But Love is a splendid thing....
